abstract: Kevin Johnson’s exit comes as Steven A. Ballmer, Microsoft’s chief executive, is shaking up top-level staff in a bid to improve Microsoft’s Internet search and ad business.
snippet: Kevin Johnson’s exit comes as Steven A. Ballmer, Microsoft’s chief executive, is shaking up top-level staff in a bid to improve Microsoft’s Internet search and ad business.
lead_paragraph: Kevin Johnson, the executive in charge of Microsoft’s struggling online business, is leaving the company. Microsoft announced Wednesday evening that Mr. Johnson was departing to become chief executive of Juniper Networks.

headline.main: Head of Microsoft’s Online Efforts Departs
headline.print_headline: Leader of Microsoft’s Online Efforts Departs Amid a Shake-Up

abstract: Call it junkware. Or bloatware or demoware or adware. It’s the software preinstalled on new Windows computers. In other words, marketers are using the computer you just bought as a billboard.
snippet: Call it junkware. Or bloatware or demoware or adware. It’s the software preinstalled on new Windows computers. In other words, marketers are using the computer you just bought as a billboard.
lead_paragraph: CALL it junkware. Or call it bloatware or demoware or adware. Computer users denounce it as crapware. It’s the software preinstalled on new Windows computers. (Bloatware is entirely a Windows issue; Macs don’t have such software.) It is there, usually in a trial version, to entice users to try a particular service or buy the full-featured program.

headline.main: Exorcise the Demons That Come Preinstalled
headline.print_headline: Exorcise the Demons That Come Preinstalled

abstract: Kevin Johnson, the executive in charge of Microsoft‘s struggling online business, is leaving the company. Microsoft announced Wednesday evening that Mr. Johnson was departing to become chief executive of Juniper Networks.
lead_paragraph: Kevin Johnson, the executive in charge of Microsoft‘s struggling online business, is leaving the company. Microsoft announced Wednesday evening that Mr. Johnson was departing to become chief executive of Juniper Networks.

headline.main: Head of Microsoft’s Online Efforts Departs

abstract: Microsoft is opening the Xbox to independent developers. This raises the question about whether all sorts of set top boxes, such as Xbox, Tivo, Apple TV, could be open to applications that offer interactive television and information services as well as games.
snippet: Microsoft is opening the Xbox to independent developers. This raises the question about whether all sorts of set top boxes, such as Xbox, Tivo, Apple TV, could be open to applications that offer interactive television and information services as w...
lead_paragraph: The open season on openness has reached that most closed of societies: the video game console. Microsoft is now creating a method for almost anyone to write and sell games for its Xbox 360 machines.

headline.main: If Microsoft Opens the Xbox Is an App Store for Apple TV Next?

abstract: Kevin Johnson leaves Microsoft after having revived neither of his two main units: Windows and Microsoft’s online operation. That may have been too much for one person, particularly because of the way Microsoft organizes itself.
snippet: Kevin Johnson leaves Microsoft after having revived neither of his two main units: Windows and Microsoft’s online operation. That may have been too much for one person, particularly because of the way Microsoft organizes itself.
lead_paragraph: I don’t know Kevin Johnson well enough to assess how much his departure will be a loss for Microsoft or a boon to Juniper Networks, where he will become chief executive.

headline.main: Can Steve Ballmer Organize Microsoft to Succeed?

abstract: Steve Ballmer is charging after Apple and Google, which mainly sell to individuals. He may be ignoring the best path to continued sucess for Microsoft, enterprise customers.
snippet: Steve Ballmer is charging after Apple and Google, which mainly sell to individuals. He may be ignoring the best path to continued sucess for Microsoft, enterprise customers.
lead_paragraph: Reading Steve Ballmer’s memo about the company’s strategy made me think that there is a bit of good news hidden in all those companies that don’t want to upgrade from Windows XP to Windows Vista.

headline.main: For Microsoft, There’s No Place Like Enterprise
